intro: Manettia chrysoderma, commonly known as the golden leaf vine, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and heart-shaped, glossy leaves. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant color and climbing habit. The leaves are typically used in traditional medicine in some regions, though its primary botanical interest lies in its floral structure and growth pattern.
